methods.isAfter:
Is one date after another?

:param date1: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:param date2: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:return: (boolean) true if date1 is chronologically after date2; false otherwise.
methods.isAfterQuiet:
Is one date after another?

 This does not check that dates are formatted correctly. Could be disastrous if date1 and date2
 are not ISO-8601 compliant!

:param date1: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:param date2: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:return: (boolean) true if date1 is chronologically after date2; false otherwise.
methods.isBefore:
Is one date before another?

:param date1: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:param date2: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:return: (boolean) true if date1 is chronologically before date2; false otherwise.
methods.isBeforeQuiet:
Is one date before another?

 This does not check that dates are formatted correctly. Could be disastrous if date1 and date2
 are not ISO-8601 compliant!

:param date1: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:param date2: (java.lang.String) - if null return false
:return: (boolean) true if date1 is chronologically before date2; false otherwise.
methods.minusDays:
Subtract a number of days from a given date.

:param date: (java.lang.String) - date
:param days: (int) - days to subtract
:return: (java.lang.String) the day days before date
methods.minusDaysQuiet:
Subtract a number of days from a given date.

 This does not check that dates are formatted correctly.

:param date: (java.lang.String) - date
:param days: (int) - days to subtract
:return: (java.lang.String) the day days before date
methods.monthOfYear:
Gets the month of the year for the date.

:param date: (java.lang.String) - date; if null return NULL_INT
:return: (int) month of the year for the date. Jan = 1, Dec = 12
methods.plusDays:
Add a number of days from a given date.

:param date: (java.lang.String) - date
:param days: (int) - days to add
:return: (java.lang.String) the day days after date
methods.plusDaysQuiet:
Add a number of days from a given date.

 This does not check that dates are formatted correctly.

:param date: (java.lang.String) - date
:param days: (int) - days to add
:return: (java.lang.String) the day days after date

text:
Basic utilities for Date Strings.

 To comply with the ISO-8601 standard for dates, Strings should be of the form "yyyy-MM-dd"

 Quiet methods are functionally equivalent to their counterparts, but assume Date String validity to remove the
 overhead of checking.
